alert.note: Alert for Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 03 at 10:13AM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Henry County in southeastern Alabama, Clay, Randolph, Calhoun, northern Early, Quitman and western Terrell Counties in southwestern Georgia through NOON EDT/1100 AM CDT/... At 1112 AM EDT/1012 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles northwest of Cuthbert to near Fort Gaines to 8 miles east of Abbeville. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Morgan, Georgetown, Dawson, Cuthbert, Edison, Arlington, Shellman, Parrott, Bellville, Bluffton, Shorterville, Wire Bridge, Parksville, Carnegie, Hayes, Watson Crossroads, Ricks Place and Pecan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EDT/400 PM CDT/ for southeastern Alabama...and southwestern Georgia.
